metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8114 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Roundcube Webmail allows arbitrary password resets by authenticated users. This affects versions before 1.0.11, 1.1.x before 1.1.9, and 1.2.x before 1.2.5. The problem is caused by an improperly restricted exec call in the virtualmin and sasl drivers of the password plugin.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8114` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

roundcube - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-core - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-mysql - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-pgsql - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-plugins - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-sqlite3 - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: roundcube package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.6+dfsg.1-1').
